channel.title: Tonsils on VitaminDWiki
channel.description: Recent content in Tonsils on VitaminDWiki

item.title: Vitamin D and pregnancy, preterm birth, preeclampsia - Whittle
item.description:
• Proper vitamin D3 supplementation: Pregnant women and their future children first!
      • Pregnancy topics (and # of studies) in VitaminDWiki as of Oct 2024
      • Infant-Child topics (and # of studies) in VitaminDWiki as of Oct 2024
      • Vitamin D is needed as soon as possible after conception

Proper vitamin D3 supplementation: Pregnant women and their future children first!

Two or more lives hang in the balance. Be sure to avoid paracetamol / acetominophen.

item.title: Highly likely that neonate will be vitamin D deficient if the mother was
item.description:
• Estimation of Vitamin D Levels in Neonatal Cord Blood Sample & its Correlation with Maternal Vitamin D Levels During Pregnancy
      • Links to infant-child and Vitamin D subjects
      • A few recent studies of low vitamin D in infants/Children

Estimation of Vitamin D Levels in Neonatal Cord Blood Sample & its Correlation with Maternal Vitamin D Levels During Pregnancy

Afr. J. Biomed. Res. Vol. 27, No.1s (September) 2024

Dr Wajid Rana 1, Dr Jabeena Banoo 2, Dr Sharvil Dhar 3, Dr Ariba Afeeh 4*, Dr Akhil

item.title: Number 1 Vitamin D Danger You Absolutely Must Know! - with transcript
item.description:
• Dr. Ekberg, YouTube 26 minutes
      • Transcript
      • Toxic only if take a LOT of vitamin D for many weeks
      • 94 proofs that that Vitamin D works

Dr. Ekberg, YouTube 26 minutes

There is more to Vitamin D supplements than taking a pill.

Most Doctor’s recommendations do not account for how

Vitamin D Foods https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uyUoK…

Vitamin D Deficiency Signs https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WRXVU…

Transcript

Author’s slides

Transcript

Low D ==> poor health, #1 deficiency in the world

0:00:02.7 Hello, Health Champions. Today, we’re gonna talk about the number one vitamin D danger you must know. You can make a very strong case for vitamin D being the number one deficiency in the world . And not only that, but it’s of critical importance and we’re only just learning just how important it is. In fact, some people have said that it’s a biomarker of chronic disease and frailty . In other words, looking at nothing else, like you only get one thing on the blood work and there’s a very strong correlation between your vitamin D status and how well you’re doing overall. So we’re gonna talk about a number of critical steps that we all have to have in place in order for us to utilize vitamin D properly. And if you wanna follow along and get a copy of these slides, then there’s a link down below so that you can get that.

item.title: 31 Vitamin D Deficiency Symptoms
item.description:
• 23 WEIRD Vitamin D Deficiency Symptoms Video - Dr. Berg
      • Surprising signs of vitamin D deficiency:
      • Common symptoms of Vitamin D deficiency
      • His references are all from VitaminDWiki
      • VitaminDWiki Mega-Search

23 WEIRD Vitamin D Deficiency Symptoms Video - Dr. Berg

Surprising signs of vitamin D deficiency:

  1. Nightmares

  2. Restless leg syndrome

  3. Acne

  4. Bipolar disorder

  5. Skipped heartbeats

  6. Breathing disorders

  7. Psoriasis and eczema

  8. Sinus issues

  9. Hay fever

  10. Rapid breathing in infants

  11. Recurrent tonsillitis in children

item.title: Chronic tonsillitis virtually eliminated in children by Vitamin D (50,000 IU weekly) – RCT
item.description:
• Impact of vitamin D in children with chronic tonsillitis (immunohistochemical study of CD68 polarisation and proinflammatory cytokines estimation)

Impact of vitamin D in children with chronic tonsillitis (immunohistochemical study of CD68 polarisation and proinflammatory cytokines estimation)

Sci Rep . 2023 May 17;13(1):8014. doi: 10.1038/s41598-023-33970-x.

Ayat Abu-Elnasr Awwad 1, Rehab A Hasan 2, Mohamed Ghazy Attia Hablas 3, Osama Mohammad Mohammad Abdelhay 4, Yahia Mohmmed Ahmed Dawood 5, Bothina Ahmed Mohamed 1, Khadiga Abdallah Abd Rabou 1, Taghreed Mahmoud Mohamed Salem 1, Marwa Elhady 6, Gehad Nabil Abd El-Aal 6, Ahmed Helal Elsayed Ahmed 7, Ahmed Ibrahim Mostafa Hasan 7, Asmaa Abd Elsalam Elmadbouly 8, Mohamed Basiouny Yahia 9, Walaa Mohamed Omar Ashry 10, Said S M M El Sayed 4, Ashraf M M Algendy 4, Ahmad M F Alkot 4, Mohamed F Farag 11, Ashraf Abdel Aty El Shenawy Emara 4, Fayez Mohammed Abd Elfattah Elbayoumy 12, Hany Fawzy Ali 9, Mohamed Morshdy Aldesoky 13, Raafat Abd-Rabow Abd-Eltwab 13, Samia M Manawy 14, Eman Mohamed Faruk 15

item.title: Cancer in children (Leukemia) more likely to recur if 20-30 ng of vitamin D
item.description:
• Vitamin D abnormalities of children with recurrence of malignancy and comparison with newly diagnosed patients
      • Some health problems recur if low vitamin D
      • Note: Some health problems protect themselves by deactivating the Vitamin D Receptor
      • See also in VitaminDWiki

Vitamin D abnormalities of children with recurrence of malignancy and comparison with newly diagnosed patients

Caspian J Intern Med . 2022 Fall;13(4):735-740. doi: 10.22088/cjim.13.4.735.

Nahid Reisi 1 , Azar Mirzaei 2 , Alireza Moafi 1 , Pouran Raeissi 3 , Maryam Naghdhassani 4

item.title: Far less tonsillitis if have 30 ng of Vitamin D
item.description:
• Vitamin D Levels in Children with Recurrent Acute Tonsillitis in Jordan: A Case-Control Study
      • Vitamin D deficiency 4.3 X more-likely in those with Recurrent Tonsillitis - meta-analysis July 2021

Vitamin D Levels in Children with Recurrent Acute Tonsillitis in Jordan: A Case-Control Study

Int. J. Environ. Res. Public Health 2022, 19(14), 8744; https://doi.org/10.3390/ijerph19148744

by Baeth Moh’d Al-Rawashdeh 1,*ORCID,Mohammad Altawil 2,Fareed Khdair Ahmad 3,Abdelrahman Alharazneh 4,Lubna Hamdan 5,Ahmed S. H. Muamar 1,Sireen Alkhaldi 6ORCID,Zahraa Tamimi 7,Rawand Husami 7,Raihan Husami 7 andNidaa A. Ababneh 8

item.title: Vitamin D helps athletes while reducing their COVID-19 risk
item.description:
Updates on Sports and COVID-19

  • College Sports Has Reported at Least 6,629 Virus Cases. There Are Many More NYT Dec 11

    • “The Times was able to gather complete data for just 78 of the 130 universities in the National Collegiate Athletic Association’s Football Bowl Subdivision, the top level of college football. "

    • Thus >6,000 is for just football for only 60% of the schools - ignoring all of the other sports

item.title: Recurrent Tonsillitis 4 X more likely if low vitamin D – meta-analysis
item.description:
The Association Between Vitamin D Deficiency and Recurrent Tonsillitis: A Systematic Review and Meta-analysis

Otolaryngol Head Neck Surg. 2020 Jul 21;194599820935442. doi: 10.1177/0194599820935442

Ahmad A Mirza 1 2, Abdulrahman A Alharbi 2, Hani Marzouki 1, Talal Al-Khatib 1, Faisal Zawawi 1

Tonsillectomy, tonsollitis and Vitamin D - many studies many studies

Download the PDF from sci-hub via VitaminDWiki

Objectives: The role of vitamin D deficiency has been linked with recurrent upper respiratory tract infections, but its impact on the frequency of tonsillitis is not yet fully understood. The objective of this study is to determine the association between vitamin D deficiency and recurrent tonsillitis based on current literature.

item.title: Sleep, Vitamin D, B Vitamins, jaw, etc. Dr. Gominak transcript - 2016
item.description:
Interview on YouTube

Transcript is down this page (transcript can be read in 102+ languages)

Nice transcript by Scribie.com $0.83 / minute

Download the Audio file

Download the un-highlighted transcript text

Key Takeaways (from YouTube)

02:29 Hundreds of Dr. Gominak’s patients, children, teenagers and young healthy females, didn’t have REM sleep.

04:42 Sleep apnea, fibromyalgia, chronic fatigue were not recognized in the 1960s and 1970s, because they were not epidemic.

item.title: Vitamin D intervention – 1204 clinical trials
item.description:
Data is US Clinical Trials

There have been more US intervention trials for vitamin D than for vitamins A, C, E, and K combined

D = 1204, vs 1023 = Total A+C+E+K (A =225 + C =340 + E =328 + K =130)

Other statistics for US Vitamin D Intervention trials

  • 802 trials for those 65+

  • 252 trials for children (age 0-17)

  • 1071 trials updated information since Jan 2010

  • 744 trials registered since Jan 2010

item.title: One pill every two weeks gives you all the vitamin D most adults need
item.description:
50,000 IU of Vitamin D once every two weeks proven to prevent/treat:

Diabetes + Heart Failure + Chronic Pain + Depression + Autism + Breast Cancer + Colon Cancer + Prostate Cancer + BPH (prostate) + Preeclampsia + Premature Birth + Falls + Cognitive Decline + Respiratory Tract Infection + Influenza + Tuberculosis + Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease + Lupus + Inflammatory Bowel Syndrome + Urinary Tract Infection + Poor Sleep + Growing Pain + Multiple Sclerosis + PMS + Schizophrenia + Endometriosis + Smoking     27 problems

item.title: Tonsillectomy, tonsollitis and Vitamin D - many studies
item.description:
Tonsils and Adenoids become inflamed when a child is fighting infection

    Adenoids are lymph nodes above the tonsils

When they become inflamed they need to be aided, by vitamin D?, but not removed

400,000 Tonsillectomies per year in US costing $ 5,400 each average

Note: Would need to breath thru the nose, not the mouth, to get any inhaled vitamin D to adenoids

Huge difference in rate of tonsil removals in different countries

item.title: Improved health due to vitamin D fortification in Finland
item.description:
Vitamin D Insufficiency in Young Finnish Men: Associations with bone stress fracture and respiratory tract infections

ACADEMIC DISSERTATION ILKKA LAAKSI June 2012

  • ABSTRACT
  • INTRODUCTION
  • REVIEW OF THE LITERATURE
    • History
    • Metabolism and mechanism of action
  • Physiological actions of vitamin D
    • Effect on bone and calcium metabolism
    • Other actions of vitamin D
  • The role of vitamin D in immunity
    • Vitamin D and respiratory tract infections
  • Stress fractures
  • Vitamin D as a factor for prevention of stress fractures
  • Vitamin D insufficiency
  • AIMS OF THE STUDY
  • MATERIAL, SUBJECTS, AND METHODS
    • Subjects and methods (I)
    • Subjects and methods (II, III)
    • Identification of respiratory infections
    • Methods
  • Subjects and methods (IV)
    • Identification of respiratory infections
    • Methods
    • Statistical analysis
    • In the article: Association between serum 25OHD concentrations and bone stress fractures in Finnish young men (II)
    • In the article: Vitamin D supplementation for the prevention of acute respiratory tract infection: a randomised, double-blinded trial among young Finnish men (IV)
  • Improved vitamin D status after implementation of vitamin D fortification as public health policy in Finland (I)
  • The association of low serum 25OHD concentration with stress fractures and acute respiratory tract infections in young Finnish men (II, III)
    • Low serum 25OHD predicting respiratory tract infection
    • Positive association of regular exercise with serum 25OHD concentrations
    • Negative association of smoking with serum 25OHD concentrations
  • Vitamin D supplementation’s prevention of respiratory tract infections in young Finnish men (IV)
    • A slight preventive effect of vitamin D supplementation of 10 jug/d on the incidence of acute respiratory tract infections
    • Vitamin D insufficiency, commonplace among young Finnish men
  • Vitamin D fortification of milk products - improved vitamin D status
    • but no resolution of hypovitaminosis in young Finnish men
  • The association of low serum 25OHD concentration with stress fractures in young Finnish men
  • Vitamin D insufficiency as a predictor of higher risk of acute respiratory tract infection in young Finnish men
  • Possible preventive effect of vitamin D supplementation on acute respiratory tract infection during military service
  • CLICK HERE for the rest of the dissertation and reference articles

LIST OF ORIGINAL PUBLICATIONS

item.title: Evidence for Vitamin D - Grant
item.description:
by Dr. William Grant, unpublished work in progress,

for Vitamin D Council as of Aug 2011

PubMed = Aug 8, 2011 PubMed.gov , words in title and/or abstract;

   for cancer, the first number is a search using “vitamin D” and “breast cancer”

   while the second number is a search using “vitamin D”, “breast” and “cancer”

   PM2 = Feb, 2011, not updated in Aug, 2011

E = Ecol = ecological studies
